question: Managerial skills are categorized into three main types: ________ skills, human skills, and conceptual skills.
Technical skills refer to the ability to use specific ________ required to perform a particular job.
Human skills involve the ability to interact, communicate, and work well with ________.
Conceptual skills refer to the ability to think creatively, analyze situations, and make strategic ________.
Lower-level managers need more ________ skills because they work directly with employees.
Middle-level managers need more ________ skills to coordinate between employees and top management.
Top-level managers need strong ________ skills for decision-making and strategic planning.
A junior doctor uses ________ skills to diagnose and treat patients.
A hospital administrator uses ________ skills to ensure staff cooperation and patient satisfaction.
The hospital director uses ________ skills to plan for future healthcare services and investments.
